intro: Adelocaryum coelestinum, commonly known as the blue star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, which give it its common name. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Adelocaryum coelestinum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade conditions.
